result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie L Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs, fees, and surcharges; these are to include the $50 drug testing fee and the $250 DNA surcharge
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program subject to Ms. Weber's disability and in line with her abilities, as approved by the Agent

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--to submit to random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to comply with DNA sample provision

The Court finds that Ms. Weber would be eligible to have this case expunged if she completes her Probation and the conditions of Probation

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment;  the current treatment should continue along with anything else recommended by the Agent

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 11:03am. 
Defendant Katie L Weber in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock files an Amended Information which alters the date of violation for the offense. 
Service of the Amended Information admitted; reading waived.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Weber guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Weber on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment;  the current treatment should continue along with anything else recommended by the Agent 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random drug and/or alcohol screening
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program subject to Ms. Weber's disability and in line with her abilities, as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs, fees, and surcharges; these are to include the $50 drug testing fee and the $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court finds that Ms. Weber would be eligible to have this case expunged if she completes her Probation and the conditions of Probation
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given
recess 11:25am
Status conference on July 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 1:18 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Katie L Weber in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer informs the Court that they have received the evaluation and are not planning on contesting the findings, will withraw NGI plea at this time. Do have plea agreement in place, but do have one issue to further negotiate regarding expungement, but have not yet been able to reach ADA Beck.  Requests matter be set for projected plea/sentencing date in approximately 3 weeks. 
ADA Shock agrees with scheduling request
Court informs parties that It will set matter for STC and note that It will likely be plea/sentencing 
Court reminds Miss Weber that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 1:23 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC (likely plea/sentencing) 7/22/16 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Status conference on June 9, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Case called at 8:39 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Katie L Weber in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer informs the Court that Miss Weber has met with Dr. Freiburger, but no report has been received yet. 
Court reviews NGI order which shows report due over weekend, which make report due today
Atty Fischer informs the Court that if the report does not support NGI, will not likely go to trial. Requests the Court set an additional STC at this time
No objection from ADA Beck
Court reminds Miss Weber that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:44 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 6/9/16 at 1:15 pm- Send notices

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 1:53pm [mo]
Defendant Katie L Weber in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Ms. Weber waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" and "not guilty by reason of mental/disease defect"

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
The Court directs the Clerk to prepare the proper order.
recess:1:59pm

NEXT:   Hearing on 5/31/16 at 8:30am

Case called at 2:42 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Katie L Weber in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-No possession of any needles except for authorized medical purposes
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 2:45 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 3/9/16 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 4/29/16 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
